etymologies: mid 18th century. From Hindi palvār, probably lit. ‘with sails’ from pāl sail + -vār, possessive suffix

definitions: A kind of riverboat used especially in north-east India and Bangladesh, primarily for cargo.

notes.text: According to Dict. World's Watercraft (2000) at pallar, the smaller boats tend to have no sails, while the larger ones may have one or more.
